title: Vaskiy
author: Vaskiy
created_time: June 20, 2023, 08:48:16 AMLast edit: June 20, 2023, 10:28:51 AM by Vaskiy
content: Long back while having conversation with one of my girlfriend she said she was interested into cryptocurrency. Quite often she used to watch more details on Instagram posts and doesn't have proper knowledge to get into it. Days passed and today it is her birthday. I remembered the conversation and wished her. Already she had Binance, so requested her to send the bitcoin address and send a small amount of 0.0011BTC as birthday gift.I know it is not good to send gifts to the centralized exchanges. During the conversation she said she is interested to learn about trading and for that purpose she had downloaded Binance. While meeting her in person I will brief her better about the security and need for non custodial wallet.I've added the conversation that happened through the WhatsApp.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: I will advise you to try reducing the image size so it does not occupy the entire space.Code: [img width=250] link to your image [/img]  Just imagine how happy the girl will be to get her first handbag as a birthday gift, which she was never expecting. Such gifts are always cherished, and that day won't be forgotten so early by her.For now, since she is still new to crypto, a lot of the newbies are introduced to crypto through centralized exchanges as one of their safest means of storing their coins, which I see as normal for anyone who has just a little knowledge about how things work.Just try and make time, like you have said, to lecture her more about the security measures and steps she can take to safely guide her holdings and how to follow up on trades since she said she wants to get involved in trading. To me, for the main time, it could really be nice if she could just start by holding the bitcoin until she familiarizes herself with how trading works.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Vaskiy on June 20, 2023, 08:48:16 AMLong back while having conversation with one of my girlfriend she said she was interested into cryptocurrency. Quite often she used to watch more details on Instagram posts and doesn't have proper knowledge to get into it. Days passed and today it is her birthday. I remembered the conversation and wished her. Already she had Binance, so requested her to send the bitcoin address and send a small amount of 0.0011BTC as birthday gift.Some threads have discussed members giving Bitcoin gifts as birthday presents and even wedding gifts. But your case is different because your girlfriend has some background knowledge about cryptocurrencies and she desires to own the currency. I have always believed that a gift will make meaning to the receiver if he cherishes it. It is a good birthday gift and I wish she cherishes and appreciates it. QuoteI know it is not good to send gifts to the centralized exchanges. During the conversation she said she is interested to learn about trading and for that purpose she had downloaded Binance. While meeting her in person I will brief her better about the security and need for noncustodial wallet.You must inform her about the dangers of keeping money in centralized exchanges. She needs to use a non-custodian wallet and don't forget to introduce her to an open-sourced wallet. Ensure she understands crypto trading before starts putting in money. She should also know that trading is not a get-rich-quick business. She should know that sometimes you lose and in some cases, you gain.

comments.author: LittleBitFunny
comments.body: It was a meaningful gift, and I'm sure she was delighted you did it with her. Recently I also saw a topic about giving bitcoins on the wedding day, but honestly, bitcoin will be a very meaningful gift if the recipient knows what it is and its value. But it doesn't make any sense if you give bitcoins to someone they don't know what it is. Many people will object when you and her use Binance, but in this situation, I don't think there will be any other choice as she is relatively new and maybe Binance account is the only wallet she owns. Of course, you should tell her about the pros and cons of holding bitcoins on a centralized exchange, but with that amount of bitcoins, it would be really unwise to tell her about withdrawing bitcoins to the non-custodial wallet.

The amount is quite insignificant. You could have given more ~30$ for birthday, greedy man.

comments.body: This is the best gift that one can have on her birthday because Bitcoin isn't a gift that will depreciate as time passes on,instead it will keep on appreciating. It is just like you gave someone a gold bracelet on her birthday but bitcoin is not a physical assets but a digital one.You have helped her dreams to come through,by gifting her bitcoin today since you said that she has great interest on crptocurrency, she can use this to start her bitcoin journey. You should meet her in person and explain to her the reasons why centralized exchanges are not safe and teach her about a noncustodial wallet, so that she can keep her coins safe in her wallet and also transfer to an exchange when she wants to trade since she is interested in trading.OP, you have just made someone birthday a memory.
